issue.title: Compilation error on Windows due to not found UCRT headers

content.raw:
> Have you tried a clean rebuild? Does the assert.h file exist in your include dirs?

This was  a clean build from the most recent `gazebo11` commit. `assert.h` should be part of the headers provided  by the compiler as it is a standard C header, so to be honest I am not fully understanding how the Windows SDK plays a role here. However, I will enable the compilation of tests to reproduce the problem and check for a solution that works in all situations.
content.html:
Have you tried a clean rebuild? Does the assert.h file exist in your include dirs?

This was a clean build from the most recent gazebo11 commit. assert.h should be part of the headers provided by the compiler as it is a standard C header, so to be honest I am not fully understanding how the Windows SDK plays a role here. However, I will enable the compilation of tests to reproduce the problem and check for a solution that works in all situations.
